translation: brzuszek [informal; the stomach or the front part of the body between your chest and your legs]
sentence: He fell asleep with a full belly and a happy heart.

translation: szantaż [the act of getting money from people or forcing them to do something by threatening to tell a secret of theirs or to harm them]
sentence: If you are in a position of authority, any weakness leaves you open to blackmail.
She looked pretty in a simple cotton dress.

translation: czołgać się [to move along on hands and knees or with your body stretched out along a surface]
sentence: I crawled under the desk to plug the lamp in.

translation: port [an area of water next to the coast, often protected from the ocean by a thick wall, where ships and boats can shelter]
sentence: Our hotel room overlooked a pretty little fishing harbor.

translation: pokrętło, gałka [a round switch on a machine such as a television that you use to turn it on and off, etc.]
sentence: Turn the black knob to switch on the radio.

translation: skok [a long or high jump; a sudden large change or increase in something]
sentence: Few people successfully make the leap from television to the movies.

translation: wabić, nęcić [to persuade someone to do something or go somewhere by offering them something exciting]
sentence: She was lured into the job by the offer of a high salary.
The timbers of those old sailing ships were mostly oak.

translation: porozumienie [an official agreement that ends an argument between two people or groups]
sentence: The management and unions have reached a settlement over new working conditions.

translation: wzywać [formal; to order someone to appear in court]
sentence: He was summoned to appear before the magistrates.

translation: zeznawać [to speak seriously about something, especially in a law court, or to give or provide proof]
sentence: He testified that he had seen the man leaving the building around the time of the murder.

translation: spód [the side of something that is usually closest to the ground]
sentence: The car had turned over in the ditch, and its underside was covered in oil and mud.
